titleInfo.title: 'File 4/60 I Bahrain Air Navigation Agreement Re Payments.'

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file, except where enclosures of an earlier date are filed after their relevant covering letter, and terminates with a set of notes on folio 9.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 9; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file concerns payments due to the Shaikh of Bahrain (Salmān bin Ḥamad Āl Khalīfah) under the terms of the Bahrain Civil Air Agreement (also referred to in the file as the Air Navigation Agreement). The papers include correspondence from the British Residency, Bahrain (enclosing correspondence from the Foreign Office General Department); schedule of sums payable to the Shaikh of Bahrain under the terms of the agreement, for the year ending 31 December 1950 (detailing annual rent of £500; individual payments of £150 for each additional service over and above the first service operating during 1949, for flying boats and land aeroplanes respectively; and total amount due); and letters from the Political Agent, Bahrain to the Manager, Eastern Bank Limited, and to the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave), forwarding copies of the preceding schedule, and (in the case of the latter recipient) explaining that the sum involved was paid by means of a credit adjustment to the Bahrain Government account in London.
